result.execSummary:
The defendant Donald Robinson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Court ordered all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges waived due to low income.
Consecutive to: Any other sentence; No Huber privileges. Court objects to ES.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donald Robinson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Donald Robinson in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Defendant Donald Robinson in custody.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve  FOUR MONTHS  in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 46 days time served.  No Huber privileges . Court objects to ES. 

Court ordered all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges waived due to low income.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Attorney Alexis B Stewart in court, defendant Donald Robinson not in court, in custody.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 06-08-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Alexis B Stewart in court, defendant Donald Robinson not in court, in custody.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 06-03-2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Donald Robinson
Current: 3225 N 14th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53206   (Effective: 04-28-2015)
Prior: 1820 West Wells Street, Milwaukee, WI 53233

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with: Jamal C and Family Dollar 2510 W North Ave

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
